node.title: Bat Bradman used to set records smashes another one with $245k sale
node.description: The cricket bat used by Sir Donald Bradman in the 1934 Ashes series is now the most expensive bat in the world.
node.content:
["The cricket bat used by Sir Donald Bradman in the 1934 Ashes series is now the most expensive bat in the world after selling at auction.", "Online bidding for the William Sykes & Son bat reached $245,500,\u00a0with the winning sum\u00a0slightly higher.", "Pickles Auctions executive director\u00a0Gavin Dempsey said the item was one of the rarest pieces of Australian sporting memorabilia.", "Bradman wrote his two top scores from the series \u2013 304 at Headingley and 244 at the Oval \u2013 on the back of the bat.", "It is also inscribed with \"Bradman personal\" \u2014 the mark that distinguishes his game bats from those he signed.", "\"In my opinion it is one of Bradman's top two or three bats,\" Mr Dempsey said.", "", "
Bradman wrote his scores from the series on the back of the bat.(ABC Illawarra: Tim Fernandez)
", "
Bat to remain in museum
", "The willow was purchased by an anonymous Australian collector, despite strong interest from overseas bidders.", "The new owner has promised to keep it on display at the Bradman Museum in Bowral, where it has been part of the collection for the past 25 years.", "\"They have bought it on the basis that they want to keep it in the public eye, keep it in the museum,\" Mr Dempsey said.", "", "
The Bradman Museum hopes the new owner of the bat allows it to remain on display.(ABC Illawarra: Justin Huntsdale)
", "The 1934 series was the first Ashes to be held in the wake of the bodyline controversy in Australia the year before.", "Bradman secured his highest-ever partnership in the series-winning match in London alongside Bill Ponsford.", "In September another of Bradman's bats sold in Adelaide for a then-record price of $203,305."]
